member.summary: Represents a collection of functions to interact with the API endpoints

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.IAuthorizationApiSync.DeleteToken(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Delete token
member.remarks:
Available in MHC Create, MHC EngageCX. Delete a specific session token. Example: ```curl -X DELETE https://api.example.com/api/v2/token?accessToken=TOKEN:c87ca566-2587-4480-8a7a-27531f04af80 ```

SDK method: ```Authorization.DeleteToken```
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: The AccessToken of type string to delete on the server. (optional)

SDK method: ```Authorization.DeleteToken```
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: The AccessToken of type string to delete on the server. (optional)

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.IAuthorizationApiSync.GetToken(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get token
member.remarks:
Available in MHC Create, MHC EngageCX. To generate an access token, call this method and supply the user credentials in the request headers. Credentials must be supplied using standard Basic HTTP Authentication. Note that user names and passwords are case sensitive. Example: ```curl -u username:password https://api.example.com/api/v2/token ```

SDK method: ```Authorization.GetToken```
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.IAuthorizationApiSync.GetTokenWithHttpInfo(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get token
member.remarks:
Available in MHC Create, MHC EngageCX. To generate an access token, call this method and supply the user credentials in the request headers. Credentials must be supplied using standard Basic HTTP Authentication. Note that user names and passwords are case sensitive. Example: ```curl -u username:password https://api.example.com/api/v2/token ```

SDK method: ```Authorization.GetToken```
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.summary: Get token using SSO Authentication
member.remarks:
Available in MHC EngageCX. To generate an access token, call this method and supply your credentials. Credentials must be supplied using SAML 2.0 or WS-Federation.

SDK method: ```Authorization.GetTokenSSO```
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.IAuthorizationApiSync.GetTokenWindows(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get token using Windows Authentication
member.remarks:
Available in MHC EngageCX. To generate an EngageCX access token, call this method and supply the environment name. This method only applies if Enterprise login with Active Directory is enabled. If AD user store sync is enabled, an EngageCX user will automatically be created if needed for the current AD user.

SDK method: ```Authorization.GetTokenWindows```
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: T:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.IDirectDataApiSync
member.summary: Represents a collection of functions to interact with the API endpoints

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.IDirectDataApiSync.Data(EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Model.DataRequestEntity,System.Int32)
member.summary: Direct get data
member.remarks:
Available in MHC Create, MHC EngageCX. Process a data model diagram and return the output data as a stream.

Example:
```curl -H \"Content-Type: application/json\" -X POST -d \"{ 'InputSettings' : { 'Diagram' : { 'Workspace' : 'Default', 'Path' : 'Bookstore Invoice\\\\Invoice.edx' } } }\" -u token: \"https://api.example.com/api/v2/data\"```

SDK method: ```DirectData.Data```
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: T:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.IDirectJobsApiSync
member.summary: Represents a collection of functions to interact with the API endpoints

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.IDirectJobsApiSync.Run(EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Model.DirectDirectJobRequestEntity,System.Int32)
member.summary: Run transient job.
member.remarks:
Available in MHC EngageCX. Run a transient job in an synchronous mode, and return the output. If the workflow is not configured to be run in transient mode, the request will fail.

Example:
```curl -H \"Content-Type: application/json\" -X POST -d \"{ 'Workflow': { 'Workspace':'Default', 'Path':'Design\\\\Telephone Invoice\\Main.wk4'} }\" -u token: \"https://api.example.com/api/v2/jobs\"```

SDK method: ```Jobs.CreateJob```
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: Which communication or workflow file to use to create job. (optional)

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.IDirectJobsApiSync.RunWithHttpInfo(EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Model.DirectDirectJobRequestEntity,System.Int32)
member.summary: Run transient job.
member.remarks:

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.IDistributionApiSync.GetEmailTicket(System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get email ticket
member.remarks:
Available in MHC EngageCX. Returns an email ticket by its id from the current environment.

Example:
```curl -u \"TOKEN:c87ca566-2587-4480-8a7a-27531f04af80:\" \"https://api.example.com/api/v2/tickets/email/123\"```

SDK method: ```Distribution.GetEmailTicket```
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: The id of the email ticket
A comma separated list of additional fields to be included. Supported values: \"content\", \"tags\", \"logs\" (optional)

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.IDistributionApiSync.GetEmailTickets(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Int32)
member.summary: Get email tickets
member.remarks:
Available in MHC EngageCX. Returns the list of tickets in email queues, optionally filtered by a queue name, ticket status, job status or job id.

Example:
```curl -u \"TOKEN:c87ca566-2587-4480-8a7a-27531f04af80:\" \"https://api.example.com/api/v2/tickets/email\"```

SDK method: ```Distribution.GetEmailTickets```
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: The queue name. If specified, the results will be filtered after the queue (optional)

The ticket status. If specified, the results will be filtered after the ticket status. Supported values: \"Waiting\", \"Processing\", \"Failed\", \"Sent\", \"Bounced\", \"Delivered\", \"Complained\", \"Rejected\", \"Read\", \"Suspended\". Case insensitive. (optional)
The job id. If specified, the results will be filtered after the job (optional)

The job status. If specified, the results will be filtered after the job status. Supported values: \"Starting\", \"WaitingForInput\", \"WaitingForSignature\", \"Processing\", \"WaitingForTask\", \"FinishedWithErrors\", \"FinishedOK\", \"Aborted\". Case insensitive. (optional)
A comma separated list of additional fields to be included. Supported values: \"content\", \"tags\", \"logs\" (optional)

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.IDistributionApiSync.GetEmailTicketsWithHttpInfo(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Int32)

member.remarks:
Available in MHC EngageCX. Returns the list of tickets in email queues, optionally filtered by a queue name, ticket status, job status or job id.

Example:
```curl -u \"TOKEN:c87ca566-2587-4480-8a7a-27531f04af80:\" \"https://api.example.com/api/v2/tickets/email\"```

SDK method: ```Distribution.GetEmailTickets```
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: The queue name. If specified, the results will be filtered after the queue (optional)

The ticket status. If specified, the results will be filtered after the ticket status. Supported values: \"Waiting\", \"Processing\", \"Failed\", \"Sent\", \"Bounced\", \"Delivered\", \"Complained\", \"Rejected\", \"Read\", \"Suspended\". Case insensitive. (optional)
The job id. If specified, the results will be filtered after the job (optional)

The job status. If specified, the results will be filtered after the job status. Supported values: \"Starting\", \"WaitingForInput\", \"WaitingForSignature\", \"Processing\", \"WaitingForTask\", \"FinishedWithErrors\", \"FinishedOK\", \"Aborted\". Case insensitive. (optional)
A comma separated list of additional fields to be included. Supported values: \"content\", \"tags\", \"logs\" (optional)

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.IRepositoryApiSync.GetFiles(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get files
member.remarks:
Available in MHC Create, MHC EngageCX. Returns a list of file metadata from the specified folder path and workspace. Note: To search files after a tag you need to specify both tagName and tagValue. Note: If the path is a file the result will contain a list of one file metadata from the specified file path.

Example:
```curl -u \"TOKEN:c87ca566-2587-4480-8a7a-27531f04af80:\" \"https://api.example.com/api/v2/files?workspace=Default&path=Retail/Bookstore%20Invoice\"```

SDK method: ```Repository.GetFiles```
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: A comma separated list of additional fields to be included. Supported values: \"tags\" (optional)
Name of the tag to search for. If tag is specified the endpoint will perform an in depth search of specified folder path. (optional)
Value of the tag to search for. If tag is specified the endpoint will perform an in depth search of specified folder path. (optional)

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.IRepositoryApiSync.UpdateFolderPermissions(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Model.FolderPermissionsEntity},System.Int32)
member.summary: Update folder permissions
member.remarks:
Available in MHC EngageCX. Update folder permissions. Permissions could be: \"Folder Read\", \"Folder Write\", \"Folder Delete\", \"File Read\", \"File Write\", \"File Delete\". If body is empty or is an empty arrary, folder permssions will be reset. UserId and GroupId are mutual exclusive. Example: ```curl -H \"Content-Type: application/json\" -X POST -d \"[ GroupId : 2, Permissions: [ \"Folder Read\", \"Folder Write\", \"Folder Delete\" ] ]\" -u token: \"https://api.example.com/api/v2/folders/permissions?workspace=Default&path=Retail\"```

SDK method: ```Repository.UpdateFolderPermissions```
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.IRepositoryApiAsync.GetFilesAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Get files
member.remarks:
Available in MHC Create, MHC EngageCX. Returns a list of file metadata from the specified folder path and workspace. Note: To search files after a tag you need to specify both tagName and tagValue. Note: If the path is a file the result will contain a list of one file metadata from the specified file path.

Example:
```curl -u \"TOKEN:c87ca566-2587-4480-8a7a-27531f04af80:\" \"https://api.example.com/api/v2/files?workspace=Default&path=Retail/Bookstore%20Invoice\"```

SDK method: ```Repository.GetFiles```
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: A comma separated list of additional fields to be included. Supported values: \"tags\" (optional)
Name of the tag to search for. If tag is specified the endpoint will perform an in depth search of specified folder path. (optional)
Value of the tag to search for. If tag is specified the endpoint will perform an in depth search of specified folder path. (optional)
Cancellation Token to cancel the request.

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.IRepositoryApiAsync.UpdateFolderPermissionsAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Model.FolderPermissionsEntity},System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Update folder permissions
member.remarks:
Available in MHC EngageCX. Update folder permissions. Permissions could be: \"Folder Read\", \"Folder Write\", \"Folder Delete\", \"File Read\", \"File Write\", \"File Delete\". If body is empty or is an empty arrary, folder permssions will be reset. UserId and GroupId are mutual exclusive. Example: ```curl -H \"Content-Type: application/json\" -X POST -d \"[ GroupId : 2, Permissions: [ \"Folder Read\", \"Folder Write\", \"Folder Delete\" ] ]\" -u token: \"https://api.example.com/api/v2/folders/permissions?workspace=Default&path=Retail\"```

SDK method: ```Repository.UpdateFolderPermissions```
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: Cancellation Token to cancel the request.

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.RepositoryApi.GetFiles(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Get files Available in MHC Create, MHC EngageCX. Returns a list of file metadata from the specified folder path and workspace. Note: To search files after a tag you need to specify both tagName and tagValue. Note: If the path is a file the result will contain a list of one file metadata from the specified file path.

Example:
```curl -u \"TOKEN:c87ca566-2587-4480-8a7a-27531f04af80:\" \"https://api.example.com/api/v2/files?workspace=Default&path=Retail/Bookstore%20Invoice\"```

SDK method: ```Repository.GetFiles```
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: A comma separated list of additional fields to be included. Supported values: \"tags\" (optional)
Name of the tag to search for. If tag is specified the endpoint will perform an in depth search of specified folder path. (optional)
Value of the tag to search for. If tag is specified the endpoint will perform an in depth search of specified folder path. (optional)

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.RepositoryApi.UpdateFolderPermissions(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Model.FolderPermissionsEntity},System.Int32)
member.summary:
Update folder permissions Available in MHC EngageCX. Update folder permissions. Permissions could be: \"Folder Read\", \"Folder Write\", \"Folder Delete\", \"File Read\", \"File Write\", \"File Delete\". If body is empty or is an empty arrary, folder permssions will be reset. UserId and GroupId are mutual exclusive. Example: ```curl -H \"Content-Type: application/json\" -X POST -d \"[ GroupId : 2, Permissions: [ \"Folder Read\", \"Folder Write\", \"Folder Delete\" ] ]\" -u token: \"https://api.example.com/api/v2/folders/permissions?workspace=Default&path=Retail\"```

SDK method: ```Repository.UpdateFolderPermissions```

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.ISecurityApiSync.CreateGroup(System.String,EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Model.GroupRequestEntity,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create group
member.remarks:
Available in MHC Create, MHC EngageCX. Creates a new group in the current environment. If provided, the permissions and users will be attached to the group. Note: The authenticated user must have permission to manage environment.

Example:
```curl -H \"Content-Type: application/json\" -X POST -d \"{'Name':'Marketing','Permissions':[{'Workspace':'Default','Access':false,'Manage':false}],'Users':[]}\" -u token: \"https://api.example.com/api/v2/groups\"```

SDK method: ```Security.CreateGroup```
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: A comma separated list of additional fields to be included. Supported values: users, nouserids, onlyworkspaceswithpermissions (optional)

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.ISecurityApiSync.UpdateGroup(System.Int32,EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Model.GroupRequestEntity,System.Int32)
member.summary: Update group
member.remarks:
Available in MHC Create, MHC EngageCX. Updates a group. Can be used to rename the group, change group permissions and add/remove users. If the group does not exist a 404 error will be thrown.

Example:
```curl -H \"Content-Type: application/json\" -X PUT -d {\"Name\":\"Marketing Department\"} -u token: \"https://api.example.com/api/v2/groups/2\"```

SDK method: ```Security.UpdateGroup```

member.summary: Update user
member.remarks:
Available in MHC Create, MHC EngageCX. Updates a user with the provided information. Note: The authenticated user must have permission to manage environment. If a field is not specified or is null, the field is ignored. If the user does not exist a 404 error will be thrown.

Example:

Available in MHC EngageCX. Creates a new portal user in the current environment. Note: The authenticated user must have permission to manage environment.

Example:

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.ISecurityApiAsync.UpdateGroupAsync(System.Int32,EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Model.GroupRequestEntity,System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Update group
member.remarks:
Available in MHC Create, MHC EngageCX. Updates a group. Can be used to rename the group, change group permissions and add/remove users. If the group does not exist a 404 error will be thrown.

Example:
```curl -H \"Content-Type: application/json\" -X PUT -d {\"Name\":\"Marketing Department\"} -u token: \"https://api.example.com/api/v2/groups/2\"```

SDK method: ```Security.UpdateGroup```
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: Cancellation Token to cancel the request.

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.ISecurityApiAsync.UpdateUserAsync(System.Int32,EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Model.UpdateUserRequestEntity,System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Update user
member.remarks:
Available in MHC Create, MHC EngageCX. Updates a user with the provided information. Note: The authenticated user must have permission to manage environment. If a field is not specified or is null, the field is ignored. If the user does not exist a 404 error will be thrown.

Example:
```curl -H \"Content-Type: application/json\" -X PUT -d {\"LastName\":\"My new name\"} -u \"TOKEN:c87ca566-2587-4480-8a7a-27531f04af80:\" \"https://api.example.com/api/v2/users/2\"```

SDK method: ```Security.UpdateUser```
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: Cancellation Token to cancel the request.

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.SecurityApi.CreateGroup(System.String,EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Model.GroupRequestEntity,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Create group Available in MHC Create, MHC EngageCX. Creates a new group in the current environment. If provided, the permissions and users will be attached to the group. Note: The authenticated user must have permission to manage environment.

Example:
```curl -H \"Content-Type: application/json\" -X POST -d \"{'Name':'Marketing','Permissions':[{'Workspace':'Default','Access':false,'Manage':false}],'Users':[]}\" -u token: \"https://api.example.com/api/v2/groups\"```

SDK method: ```Security.CreateGroup```
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.SecurityApi.UpdateGroup(System.Int32,EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Model.GroupRequestEntity,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Update group Available in MHC Create, MHC EngageCX. Updates a group. Can be used to rename the group, change group permissions and add/remove users. If the group does not exist a 404 error will be thrown.

Example:
```curl -H \"Content-Type: application/json\" -X PUT -d {\"Name\":\"Marketing Department\"} -u token: \"https://api.example.com/api/v2/groups/2\"```

member.name: M:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Api.SecurityApi.UpdateUser(System.Int32,EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Model.UpdateUserRequestEntity,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Update user Available in MHC Create, MHC EngageCX. Updates a user with the provided information. Note: The authenticated user must have permission to manage environment. If a field is not specified or is null, the field is ignored. If the user does not exist a 404 error will be thrown.

Example:
```curl -H \"Content-Type: application/json\" -X PUT -d {\"LastName\":\"My new name\"} -u \"TOKEN:c87ca566-2587-4480-8a7a-27531f04af80:\" \"https://api.example.com/api/v2/users/2\"```

member.summary: Gets or sets the date time format used when serializing in the ApiClient By default, it's set to ISO 8601 - "o", for others see: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/az4se3k1(v=vs.110).aspx and https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/8kb3ddd4(v=vs.110).aspx No validation is done to ensure that the string you're providing is valid

member.name: P:EngageCX.Client.NETFramework.Client.Configuration.ApiKeyPrefix
member.summary:
Gets or sets the prefix (e.g. Token) of the API key based on the authentication name.
Whatever you set here will be prepended to the value defined in AddApiKey.
An example invocation here might be:
ApiKeyPrefix["Authorization"] = "Bearer";
… where ApiKey["Authorization"] would then be used to set the value of your bearer token.
OAuth2 workflows should set tokens via AccessToken.
member.value: The prefix of the API key.

For HttpPost CreateUser: The user's password. If this is null the server will auto generate a password. For HttpPut UpdateUser: The user's new password. When changing password, the OldPassword property is mandatory, otherwise the updating password will fail..
Describes user's job title or position.
The ids of the groups for the user to join.
If true, the user can't log in the environment. Default value is false..

The status of the ticket. Supported values are: \"Waiting\", \"Processing\", \"Failed\", \"Sent\", \"Bounced\", \"Delivered\", \"Complained\", \"Rejected\", \"Read\", \"Suspended\"..
The date when the ticket was created.
The date when the ticket finished distributing.
The name of the queue this ticket is part of.
The id of the job this ticket was generated from.
List of ticket tags IF asked for. Otherwise it's null..

The workspace name in which the document is located in EOS repository.
The path to the document in EOS repository.
The input tray of the printer.
If true, it uses the manual tray. Default value is false..
The printer mode. Can be \"Auto\", \"Simplex\" or \"Duplex\". Default value is \"Auto\"..
The number of copies. Default value is 1..
Specify whether printing is in color or in monochrome mode. Can be \"Auto\", \"Color\" or \"Monochrome\". Default value is \"Auto\"..
Specify whether documents are printed in portrait or landscape mode. Can be \"Auto\", \"Portrait\" or \"Landscape\". Default value is \"Auto\"..

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The username of the user. This needs to be unique and it is used to log in. If not specified, the email will be used as username..

For HttpPost CreateUser: The user's password. If this is null the server will auto generate a password. For HttpPut UpdateUser: The user's new password. When changing password, the OldPassword property is mandatory, otherwise the updating password will fail..
Describes user's job title or position.
The ids of the groups for the user to join.
If true, the user can't log in the environment. Default value is false..
The user's old password. Only set if you want to update the current password with a new one..
